verses.verse: I am the rose<WH2261> of Sharon<WH8289>, and the lily<WH7799> of the valleys<WH6010>.
As the lily<WH7799> among thorns<WH2336>, so is my love<WH7474> among the daughters<WH1323>.

As the apple tree<WH8598> among the trees<WH6086> of the wood<WH3293>, so is my beloved<WH1730> among the sons<WH1121>. I sat<WH3427> down under his shadow<WH6738> with great delight<WH2530>, and his fruit<WH6529> was sweet<WH4966> to my taste<WH2441>.
He brought<WH935> me to the banqueting<WH3196> house<WH1004>, and his banner<WH1714> over me was love<WH160>.
Stay<WH5564> me with flagons<WH809>, comfort<WH7502> me with apples<WH8598>: for I am sick<WH2470> of love<WH160>.
His left hand<WH8040> is under my head<WH7218>, and his right hand<WH3225> does embrace me<WH2263>.

I charge<WH7650> you<WH1323>, O you daughters of Jerusalem<WH3389>, by the roes<WH6643>, and<WH176> by the hinds<WH355> of the field<WH7704>, that you stir not up<WH5782>, nor awake<WH5782> my love<WH160>, until he please<WH2654>.
The voice<WH6963> of my beloved<WH1730>! behold<WH935>, he comes leaping<WH1801> upon the mountains<WH2022>, skipping<WH7092> upon the hills<WH1389>.

My beloved<WH1730> is like<WH1819> a roe<WH6643> or a young<WH6082> hart<WH354>: behold<WH5975>, he stands behind<WH310> our wall<WH3796>, he looks forth<WH7688> at the windows<WH2474>, showing<WH6692> himself through the lattice<WH2762>.
My beloved<WH1730> spoke<WH6030>, and said<WH559> unto me<WH6965>, Rise up, my love<WH7474>, my fair one<WH3303>, and come away<WH3212>.
For<WH5638>, behold, the winter is past<WH5674>, the rain<WH1653> is over<WH2498> and gone<WH1980>;

The flowers<WH5339> appear<WH7200> on the earth<WH776>; the time<WH6256> of the singing<WH2158> of birds is come<WH5060>, and the voice<WH6963> of the turtle<WH8449> is heard<WH8085> in our land<WH776>;

The fig tree<WH8384> puts forth<WH2590> her green figs<WH6291>, and the vines<WH1612> with the tender grape<WH5563> give<WH5414> a good smell<WH7381>. Arise<WH6965>, my love<WH7474>, my fair one<WH3303>, and come away<WH3212>.

O my dove<WH3123>, that are in the clefts<WH2288> of the rock<WH5553>, in the secret<WH5643> places of the stairs<WH4095>, let me see<WH7200> your favor<WH4758>, let me hear<WH8085> your voice<WH6963>; for sweet<WH6156> is your voice<WH6963>, and your favor<WH4758> is fitting<WH5000>.
Take<WH270> us the foxes<WH7776>, the little<WH6996> foxes<WH7776>, that plunder<WH2254> the vines<WH3754>: for our vines<WH3754> have tender grapes<WH5563>.
My beloved<WH1730> is mine<WH7462>, and I am his: he feeds among the lilies<WH7799>.

Until the day<WH3117> break<WH6315>, and the shadows<WH6752> flee away<WH5127>, turn<WH5437>, my beloved<WH1730>, and be you like<WH1819> a roe<WH6643> or a young<WH6082> hart<WH354> upon the mountains<WH2022> of Bether<WH1336>.
